text: Miscanthus fuscus, one of three species known as elephant grass, is a South Asian grass species first described by William Roxburgh, and was given its current name by George Bentham. Miscanthus fuscus is included in the genus silvergrasses, and the grass family. No subspecies are listed in the Catalogue of Life. The bamboo-like plant grows rapidly up to 3 metres high, generating a high yield of biomass with low ash content, suitable for use in electricity generation. ==References== fuscus Category:Grasses of Asia Category:Grasses of India Category:Flora of the Indian subcontinent Category:Biomass
title: Miscanthus fuscus
